text:
Welcome to How To Cook That
I am Ann Reardon Today we are making an indulgent
chocolate brownie mars bar cheesecake.

This is an easy dessert to make, tastes great
and looks impressive and you can even make
it ahead of time.

For the brownie part you will need vanilla
extract, eggs, butter, sugar, baking powder,
cocoa powder and flour.

All of thse recipe quantities are on the website
howtocookthat.net in grams, ounces and cups.

Place your butter into a bowl and then melt
that in the microwave or stove top if you
like.
Add the sugar and stir that in.

Once it is all stirred just check the bowl
and check that it is cool and if it is cool

enough you can add the eggs and stir that
in.

If you heated it on the stove top you might
need to wait a little minute for that to cool
down.

Add the vanilla and mix that through and then
just tip in the flour, baking powder and cocoa
powder.
Mix that through until it is just combined.

Then all you need to do is add in your white
and dark chocolate melts and stir again.
It really is an easy recipe that one.
Pour into a baking tin lined with baking paper.

I like to let the paper hang over the edge
on two sides just to make it easy to get it
out once it is baked.
Put it in the oven for around 15 minutes.

Until it is no longer jiggly in the middle
and if you put a knife in the middle it should
out clean.
And then you can just let that cool

To make the cheesecake part
measure out your cream cheese, cream, milk,
sugar, gelatin and water.

Tip all of the water into the gelatin, and
stir it in.

Use room temperature water here it shouldn't
be hot water, just normal.

The gelatin will soak up all of that water
so just leave that to one side.

Now we want to whip our cream to soft peaks
and then set that bowl aside.
You'll need that later.

Then in a larger bowl beat the cream cheese
until it is soft and it is important that

you beat it here until it has no lumps left
at all it should be nice and smooth.
Then add in your sugar and beat it a bit more.

Then take your gelatin that will by now look
like this, remove the spoon and microwave
until it is melted into a liquid like this.

Pour that into the cream cheese mixture and
allow to mix through, that will make it go

quite runny then add the milk, whisk that
in and add your vanilla as well and keep whisking
it until it is smooth and creamy.

Add you cream to the cheesecake mixture and
fold in using a spoon or a spatula.

Next take a tall round container with straight
sides and use your container to cut circles
of brownie.
You should get two whole ones and two halves.

Line the base and sides with non-stick baking
paper.

Put the two halves of brownie at the base
and see how we've got a gap just add extra

bits of brownie off cuts to fill up those
gaps.

Spoon in 1/3 of your cheesecake mixture and
spread it fairly flat it doesn't have to be

exact and then add another disc of your brownie
into the container on top and push it down.

Add another 1/3 of the cheesecake mixture
and the next brownie disk.

And then finish it off with the rest of the
cheesecake mixture on top.

Then place the whole thing in the freezer
overnight.

If you are making it ahead it can be in the
freezer for up to a month.

Once frozen tip it out of the container and
peel off the baking paper from the base.

Put your serving plate on top and flip it
over so that it is the right way up.

Peel of the baking paper off from around the
sides.

To decorate place your chocolate and milk
or cream into a bowl and microwave in 30 second

bursts and stir until it is nice and smooth
and a creamy ganache like this.

To make it look like it is dripping down the
sides take your spoon near the edge and drop

some of the ganache half on the cheesecake
and half over the edge.

Because the cheesecake is still frozen it
will drip down but it is going to set fairly

quickly there so you get a nice drip down
the side.

Now add a thin layer of ganache in the centre
at the top.

Chop up some mars bars or other chocolate
bars of your choice and add the off-cuts of
chocolate brownie, I hope you didn't eat those.

Add them to the top in the middle and drizzle
it with ganache.

And then arrange the mars bar slices on top
of that with more brownie on top to make it
nice and tall.

Drizzle with more ganache and then finish
it off with the last peices of mars bar on
top.

Allow to defrost it will take a couple of
hours at room temperature or over a whole

day if it is in the fridge and then serve
it up to your guests.

Subscribe to howtocookthat for more cakes
chocolate and desserts.

Click here for last weeks video, here to go
to the channel to see all the other crazy
sweet creations and here for my website.

And if you are a tumblr fan make sure you
check out the new howtocookthat page on tumblr
and reblog some of the cool gifs.

Have a great week
and I'll see you Friday.
